Question
========

Of 143 hospital patients who contracted a particular infection, the sex determined, and whether or not they survived the infection. Of the 126 survivors, 78 were male; of those who died, 13 were male. Suppose we randomly choose one of the patients. The best estimate of the probability of this patient surviving the infection is equal to

Answerlist
----------

* 0.12
* 0.64
* 0.86
* 0.88

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* 0.12: Incorrect
* 0.64: Incorrect
* 0.86: Incorrect
* 0.88: Correct
